comments.body: no action required: it would be nice if these code share workers...
Describe what this means similar to the comment above.
Presumably we would wire up different CLI flags to each signer since each can have a distinct cert and key file.

> Presumably we would wire up different CLI flags to each signer since each can have a distinct cert and key file.

yes, with a priority so the old flag works.
Will the change in the way the controllers are being registered cause any change in the way users enable/disable signing controllers?
I see a bit of prior discussion now on this ðŸ˜… https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/90731#issuecomment-624071680

> Will the change in the way the controllers are being registered cause any change in the way users enable/disable signing controllers?

It's got a single big enable block. You cannot choose individual loops here via config.

returning false here logs here:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/975d0736b35d966c50383f794c0114a34fbcd9e4/cmd/kube-controller-manager/app/controllermanager.go#L525-L528

I guess this adds an extra reason, but we did at least log they were not started, and which controller name was associated, right?

> Or even "groups" as in api-groups?

I wasn't trying to change up packages yet. I'm not even completely sure that I want to.  I was just trying to slim down the main type and get some consistency for startup.
Oh, right. That's the `app` as in `cmd/*/app`. Though you are splitting up the controllers as apps.
